page.title: 08OWERMOIGNE MEDIEVAL MANOR
page.content: {MOIGNE COURT}IS BUILT ON LAND GIVEN TO {ROGER DE MOYNE}BY{WILLIAM 1}FOR SERVICES OF{SERGEANCY OF KITCHEN.OWER} IS REPUTED TO COME FROM{OGRE}MEANING {SLOPE}.TODAY MOIGNE COURT,THE HOME OF {THE CREE FAMILY},OUR MAJOR LAND OWNER SINCE 1826 IS{GRADE 2 LISTED BUILDING, A FINE EXAMPLE OF A{MEDIEVAL MANOR {HOUSE AND THE OLDEST INHABITED HOUSE {IN DORSET}.IT HAS THREE WINDOWS DATING FROM 1263-80 IN ITS MEDIEVAL COURT ROOM,A SOLAR WING,THE REMAINS OF MEDIEVAL FISHPONDS AND IS SURROUNDED BY A RECTANGULAR MOAT.THE ORIGINAL FIRST FLOOR DOORWAY IS CLEARLY VISIBLE.A{FIRE IN 1880 RESULTED IN THE {STONE HOUSE BEING PARTLY REBUILT IN {LOCAL RED BRICK AND ITS THATCH {REPLACED BY SLATES}.TODAY THE COURT ROOM AND SOLAR WING ARE LEASED TO AN ELECTRONICS COMPANY.
